basic.description: Provides a critical introduction to surveillance and the emerging interdisciplinary field of Surveillance Studies.  Offers an historically-grounded, theoretically-informed, and empirically-illustrated survey of the practices, technologies and social relations of surveillance from different perspectives, with an emphasis on the socio-political dimensions.
basic.subject: SOCY
basic.title: Surveillance and Society

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite    A grade of C- in SOCY122.
Exclusion    No more than 3.0 units from SOCY304; SOCY309
